alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 9:22PM CDT until April 22 at 1:36PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River at Black River Falls affecting Jackson County. Black River Near Galesville affecting La Crosse and Trempealeau Counties. .Recent rains and melting snow is causing the river to rise to critical levels and cause flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River at Black River Falls. * WHEN...From this evening to early Saturday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 46.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 51.7 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 47.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 51.4 feet on 05/18/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 1200 PM CDT.
